_...remember... this is racing!_

Sorry, Interstate has a speed limit.  
And Belizio? That would be horse and buggy racing.  
Or am I being to literal in interpreting the associative qualities of a 1980s revival of a 1950s revival of an 1850s typeface?

I agree with Nick. Here are a few ideas off the top of my head...

[Scout](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018121058/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Scout&utm_source=NewsletterDec9&utm_medium=web&utm_content=Scout&utm_term=em&utm_campaign=TopTwentyTypes2008)

[Soho](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018121058/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/soho_pro_virtual/?utm_source=NewsletterDec9&utm_medium=web&utm_content=Soho&utm_term=em&utm_campaign=TopTwentyTypes2008)

[Stag](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018121058/http:/www.vllg.com/Schwartzco/Stag/mudTyper+Weights/)  
 [Stag Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018121058/http:/www.vllg.com/Schwartzco/StagSans/mudTyper+Weights/)
thank you so much. i hear what you both are saying.

Well it's something to consider, but not the absolute word.  
After all, Saab uses Gill Sans as its corporate face, which I think is inappropriate, and it doesn't seem to be an issue.  
But I think Chris' advice is good, which seems to be that if you're going for the contemporary look of, say, slab serifs, use a present-day original design, rather than a revival.

This hit-and-run stuff really chaps my hide.

hhp
